Description: This template deploys a Windows instance using Watchmaker, which applies the DISA STIG.

AmiId.Description: ID of the AMI to launch

AppScriptParams.Description: Parameter string to pass to the application script. Ignored if "AppScriptUrl" is blank

AppScriptUrl.ConstraintDescription: Must use an S3 URL (starts with "s3://") to a .bat or .ps1 file
AppScriptUrl.Description: (Optional) S3 URL to the .ps1 or .bat application script in an S3 bucket (s3://). Leave blank to launch without an application script. If specified, an appropriate "InstanceRole" is required

AppVolumeDevice.Description: (Optional) Device to mount an extra EBS volume. Leave blank to launch without an extra application volume

AppVolumeSize.Description: Size in GB of the EBS volume to create. Ignored if "AppVolumeDevice" is blank

AppVolumeType.Description: Type of EBS volume to create. Ignored if "AppVolumeDevice" is blank

CfnEndpointUrl.Description: (Optional) URL to the CloudFormation Endpoint. e.g. https://cloudformation.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

CloudWatchAgentUrl.Description: (Optional) S3 URL to CloudWatch Agent installer. Example: s3://amazoncloudwatch-agent/windows/amd64/latest/AmazonCloudWatchAgent.zip

InstanceRole.Description: (Optional) IAM instance role to apply to the instance(s)

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

NoPublicIp.Description: Controls whether to assign the instance a public IP. Recommended to leave at "true" _unless_ launching in a public subnet

NoReboot.Description: Controls whether to reboot the instance as the last step of cfn-init execution

PrivateIp.Description: (Optional) Set a static, primary private IP. Leave blank to auto-select a free IP

PythonInstaller.Description: URL to the Python Installer Executable

SecurityGroupIds.Description: List of security groups to apply to the instance

SubnetId.Description: ID of the subnet to assign to the instance

ToggleCfnInitUpdate.Description: A/B toggle that forces a change to instance metadata, triggering the cfn-init update sequence

WatchmakerAdminGroups.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain groups that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerAdminUsers.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain users that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerBootstrapper.Description: URL to the Watchmaker PowerShell bootstrapper for Windows

WatchmakerComputerName.Description: (Optional) Sets the hostname/computername within the OS

WatchmakerConfig.Description: (Optional) Path to a Watchmaker config file.  The config file path can be a remote source (i.e. http[s]://, s3://) or local directory (i.e. file://)

WatchmakerEnvironment.Description: Environment in which the instance is being deployed

WatchmakerOuPath.Description: (Optional) DN of the OU to place the instance when joining a domain. If blank and "WatchmakerEnvironment" enforces a domain join, the instance will be placed in a default container. Leave blank if not joining a domain, or if "WatchmakerEnvironment" is "$false"

Fn::Join: if (-not $?) { throw 'pip failed to install setup dependencies!' }
if (-not $?) { throw 'pip failed to install watchmaker!' }
